remarks: The congruence relation used in the Tarski structure for the Euclidean geometry is the same as ` Cgr ` .  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 15-Mar-2019.)
statement:
ecgrtg.1 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
ecgrtg.2 $e |- P = ( Base ` ( EEG ` N ) ) $.
ecgrtg.3 $e |- .- = ( dist ` ( EEG ` N ) ) $.
ecgrtg.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
ecgrtg.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
ecgrtg.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
ecgrtg.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. P ) $.
ecgrtg $p |- ( ph -> ( <. A , B >. Cgr <. C , D >. <-> ( A .- B ) = ( C .- D ) ) ) $.
